questions.question: The two main ways laws are created in Australia are called ...

choices.answer: statue law and customary law
statue law and common law
statute law and common law
Laws that are created by passing through parliament.
Laws that relate to more common issues.
Laws that are created by rulings made by judges.
A law that doesn't change so it is like a statue.
Created by being passed through parliament.
Created by a ruling made by a judge.

questions.question: Laws are either civil or criminal. What sorts of crimes come under civil law?

choices.answer: Crimes where financial compensation is being sought.
Crimes that involves the way people treat each other.
Crimes relating to harming someone's health or welfare.

questions.question: Laws are either civil or criminal. A criminal law relates to crimes where ...

choices.answer: people's health and welfare have been harmed/threatened.
some sort of compensation is being sought.
the criminal has been convicted before.

questions.question: What statement relating to International law below is correct?

choices.answer: It is is established and recognised between nations.
Over 55% of our trade is with Asia so strong IL is needed.
It is often to do with trade and relationships.
All of the statements are correct.

questions.question: Are there situations where both criminal and civil laws apply?

choices.answer: Yes
No

questions.question: Customary Law is a law that has ...

choices.answer: to do with customers being innocent until proven guilty.
developed over a long time based on Aboriginal  customs
customers rights at the centre.
